channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1999] fuse gear creation sometimes exceeds OSE install timeout "exceeded timeout of"
item.description:
Fuse gear creation sometimes fail with the following error when the node is under load.

This specific run was with a build containing patch, which may increase the time of the install script, although according to the logs it didn't make into the patching yet, so this is probably not patching-specific.

September 24 07:15:29 INFO openshift-agent: request end: action=cartridge_do, requestid=e07118b9ae195307b22dba57de1b123e, senderid=broker.hosts.sample.com, statuscode=1, data={:time=>nil, :output=>"Shell command '/sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 5422a6b58db227512300014d -c \"exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c5,c315' /bin/sh -c \\\"/var/lib/openshift/5422a6b58db227512300014d/fuse/bin/install --version 1.0.0\\\"\"' exceeded timeout of 225\n\n", :exitcode=>157, :addtl_params=>nil}

Looking at /var/log/openshift/node/platform-trace.log it seems it just didn't manage to setup in time for the default 360s openshift timeout.

September 24 07:11:44 INFO oo_spawn running /sbin/runuser -s /bin/sh 5422a6b58db227512300014d -c "exec /usr/bin/runcon 'unconfined_u:system_r:openshift_t:s0:c5,c315' /bin/sh -c \"/var/lib/openshift/5422a6b58db22
 
7512300014d/fuse/bin/install --version 1.0.0\"": {:unsetenv_others=>true, :close_others=>true, :in=>"/dev/null", :chdir=>"/var/lib/openshift/5422a6b58db227512300014d/fuse", :out=>#<IO:fd 12>, :err=>#<IO:fd 8>}

item.summary: fuse gear creation sometimes exceeds OSE install timeout "exceeded timeout of"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The upgrade still occurs when control start is called after install.
Timeout issue is discussed in ENTESB-1957

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. create some gears with rhc create-app fuseX fuse-1.0.0 --no-git
  2. deploy mq-amq on some, example-mq on others to generate some realistic load
  3. create some more gears
  4. remove some gears / repeat until it fails
